title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0001
text: What does 'decompose by subdomain' mean in microservice architecture?

options.text: Splitting services based on distinct subdomains within a business domain
Dividing services by technical layers like UI and database
Grouping all services into a single monolith

explanation: Decomposing by subdomain means structuring services around distinct subdomains within a larger business domain.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0002
text: What is the main goal of decomposing by subdomain?

options.text: To align services with domain-driven design principles
To reduce the number of services

explanation: The goal is to align services with domain-driven design principles by mapping them to subdomains.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0003
text: Which of the following best describes a subdomain?

options.text: A smaller, cohesive part of a larger business domain
A technical component like a database

explanation: A subdomain is a smaller, cohesive part of a larger business domain that represents a specific area of functionality.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0004
text: Which of the following is an example of a subdomain in an e-commerce system?
explanation: Inventory Management is a subdomain within the broader e-commerce domain.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0005
text: Which concept from Domain-Driven Design (DDD) supports decomposition by subdomain?
explanation: Bounded Context is a DDD concept that helps define clear boundaries for subdomains.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0006
text: What is the relationship between subdomains and bounded contexts?

options.text: Each subdomain is implemented within a bounded context
Bounded contexts are unrelated to subdomains
A bounded context contains multiple unrelated subdomains

explanation: Each subdomain is implemented within a bounded context that defines its boundaries and models.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0007
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by subdomain?

options.text: Improved alignment between business and technical architecture

explanation: Decomposing by subdomain improves alignment between business and technical architecture.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0008
text: Which of the following is a challenge when decomposing by subdomain?
explanation: Identifying clear subdomain boundaries is often challenging when decomposing by subdomain.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0009
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by subdomain for scalability?

options.text: Scaling is limited to the database

explanation: Decomposing by subdomain allows independent scaling of services based on business needs.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0010
text: Which of the following is a key principle when decomposing by subdomain?

options.text: Each service should encapsulate a single subdomain
Each service should handle multiple unrelated subdomains
All services should share the same database
Services should be grouped by technology

explanation: Each service should encapsulate a single subdomain to maintain clear boundaries and autonomy.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0011
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by subdomain for maintainability?

options.text: Simplifies maintenance by isolating domain logic
Centralizes all logic in one service

explanation: Decomposing by subdomain simplifies maintenance by isolating domain logic within each service.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0012
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by subdomain for team structure?

options.text: Teams can own and manage specific subdomains
Teams must share ownership of all services
Teams are organized by technology stack

explanation: Decomposing by subdomain allows teams to own and manage specific subdomains independently.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0013
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by subdomain for agility?

options.text: Enables faster delivery of domain-specific features

explanation: Decomposing by subdomain enables faster delivery of domain-specific features by reducing dependencies.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0014
text: Which of the following is a common mistake when decomposing by subdomain?

options.text: Splitting services by technical layers instead of domain boundaries

explanation: A common mistake is splitting services by technical layers instead of aligning them with domain boundaries.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0015
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by subdomain for fault isolation?

options.text: Failures are contained within specific subdomains
All services share the same process

explanation: Decomposing by subdomain improves fault isolation by containing failures within specific subdomains.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0016
text: Which of the following is a benefit of decomposing by subdomain for scalability?

options.text: Scaling requires redeploying the entire system
Scaling is limited to the database

explanation: Decomposing by subdomain allows independent scaling of services based on domain-specific demand.

title: MicroservicesServiceBoundariesSubdomain - Q0017

options.text: Each service is modular and focused on a single domain area

explanation: Decomposing by subdomain promotes modularity by designing each service around a single domain area.
